review: I must confess I was a little hesitant initially to write this feedback given the industry I come from. However, the sheer extent of positive impact that Dr. Sony's dental treatment has had on both my personal and professional life, I just could not resist myself from acknowledging her and thanking her for the same. I was quite unhappy with the way my teeth and smile looked and I did not want to go for braces to correct them, as that would have meant sitting without work for at least a year or so. after extensive online research and having been to 4 other clinics in Delhi and 1 in Mumbai, I landed up at Dr. Sony and Dr. Ruchir's clinic. Though their set-up is small (I had the chance to visit their NFC set-up too, which by the way is much more posh and very prettily done up), but their ability to diagnose a problem and then be able to offer multiple solutions for the same is simply amazing. What I really liked is the way they patiently explain the pros and cons of all treatment options, and then help you make the right decision for yourself without any bias or without forcing anything down your throat. *** ****** ******** ****** *** ****** *********** *** *** *** *** ****** ** ********** I underwent Teeth Whitening followed by a combination of Ceramic Veneers and Crowns to correct my smile. I must say I am thrilled to bits with the end  result and will happily recommend anyone who has any dental discomfort or any issues related to their smile. Go to them for their honesty, their transparency, their warmth and their ability to execute what they plan for you to perfection. God Bless you guys!

reply_text:
Dear Sir..Please note that your observations are completely unfair and not representative of the correct facts. 
Firstly, to the best of our knowledge, we have not suggested any root canal for you. Secondly, and more importantly, we do not give a prescription of medications to each and every patient we see. Prescriptions for medications are only given where we feel they are absolutely required and the medications are unavoidable. India in particular, and the world in general, has been fighting the menace of unnecessary and indiscriminate prescription of medications for a long time now. The side effects of such random medications like pain-killers and/ or antibiotics can create multiple short and long-term issues for patients at large. Hence, it is the moral duty of every ethical clinician to limit the use of medicine prescriptions to only where it is needed. We are proud that we uphold this principle and almost all our patients love us for that. The Consultation Fee (and that fee is clearly displayed on the Practo portal from where you booked your appointment) you pay is for our Consultation and Opinion regarding your problem and its management..no textbook of medicine or dentistry says that you must write medicines for every patient who comes to see you. And just for your information, it is far easier and more time-saving to quickly write a list of medicines and send the patient away, rather than actually explaining the problem to him and telling him why medicines are not needed for the time being and what is the best way to manage the situation.
Thirdly, because of the strict standards of sterilization we maintain and the protocols we rigidly follow, we are often able to limit the use of prescription medications to a large extent which actually works to the patient's advantage both in the short and long-term. So, that again actually increases our workload, but eventually makes us happier and our patients healthier.
Fourthly, your saying that we don't give prescriptions to anyone is again an incorrect generalization. We see a number of patients every day. And we have been doing so for quite a few years now. Do you really think any clinician can actually treat all problems without ever giving prescriptions?..Of course not. So, we do give prescriptions..but only when we feel patients really need it..
Finally, you say that you took time time to find our clinic. Well, we are sorry but cant really help with that. Maybe you found it difficult because it was your first visit. But, so many of our patients from different parts of Delhi and NCR region, as well as different parts of India and even abroad are able to reach us at our address.
Sir..In today's times it is not easy to stick to ideal principles of practice. We try and make our best efforts to do what is right for our patients without succumbing to short-cuts (like writing needless prescriptions) or worrying about other irrelevant considerations. We regret the fact that you found this approach incorrect. But we would like to reassure you that we have nothing but your best interests in mind. Your heath and well-being, and that of all our patients, is sacred to us. We are here to do a job and we are always hopeful that in doing the job to the best of our abilities, it also makes us popular with our patients (which to a very large extent it does).  But even if doing the right thing brings us some unpopularity, then so be it. We are here to do what is right for you and all our patients, and we shall not give that up for anything (not even our popularity). 
Hope you can see things in better light now. Wishing you good luck and good health. God Bless!
